meanings.definition: Unpaid labor imposed by a government or other authority.
meanings.sent1: The villagers had to work the corvee in the fields without pay.
meanings.sent2: The corvee system required the people to work for the ruler without compensation.
meanings.sent3: The corvee duty was like a never-ending chore for the community.
meanings.sent4: The burden of the corvee weighed heavily on the shoulders of the workers.
meanings.sent5: The corvee was a harsh taskmaster, demanding labor without reward.

meanings.sent1: Under the corvee, individuals were compelled to work against their will.
meanings.sent2: The corvee was a harsh practice that deprived people of their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The corvee system felt like a never-ending cycle of toil and hardship.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the corvee pressed down on the workers, leaving them exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The corvee enforced labor through coercion and authority.

meanings.sent1: The ruler would corvee the villagers to work in the fields.
meanings.sent2: They would corvee the laborers to complete the construction project.
meanings.sent3: He would corvee his friends to help him move to a new house.
meanings.sent4: She would corvee her siblings to assist with her school project.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor would corvee the employees to stay late and finish the task.
